text: Friday the 13th.  I can't remember if I eventually managed to actually beat it or not, but it was certainly pretty creepy at the time.  Castlevania II was an early, and more memorable 'horror' game, and one of the first "open-world-ish" game that I actually managed to finish (with perhaps a bit of help from Nintendo Power, but I was still proud of it at the time).

There's a Castlevania easter egg and Vampire Killer song in Contra - Hard Cops. Best Contra game IMO - the song is called "Contra Hard Corps OST - Simon 1994rd"

text:
I'll be honest, I actually was less fond of Vampire Killer, NOT because I think it's a bad song at all, but because it's not quite as... dark? as the best Castlevania songs are.  It's like, it's not quite as atmospheric as some of it's best entries.  At least the NES versions of the song.

It's pretty much the only thing I felt Simon's Quest did completely better.  So much of the music in that game felt oppressive, which is exactly the way it should be.  :o

author: zack s

text: @bsznm Lol, I had thoughts about the same things at one point. Technically, music is only a form of expression so generally in reality there is no standard for quality but a preference of types. I think its kind of a mix of both of your latter statements, because certain types of music are defined by the type of sounds made, and the newer ones might have had poor instrument choice and could use work on the arrangement. Kinda like bramble blast. The new one has a different feel with orchestration
author: Nuerysm

text:
notice how it gets perceptively worse as they arrange it in more powerful sound systems.

is that because the limited instruments in the earlier ones subconsciously lower our standards? or is it because the theme was truly good, but was so tailored to the limited palette that it doesn't work outside of it? or is it just because the later arrangements happen to be poorly executed?

these are the stupid things i think about

text: Lament of Innocence was both my first (as in, the "purest") horror-themed game and my first and still only Castlevania game this far (unfortunately). Even if it's not the best in the series (I can't really tell), I'm happy I finally could try a series I've been so curious about for many years - due to its awesome music. And now I know I'd love the rest of the games too... there's simply no way a Castlevania game could go wrong.

text: This was my first horror game as well (Castlevania NES)  As far as all time fave, it's a tie between Dracula X for the SNES and SOTN for the PS1. And for Konami to keep it 2D on a system focusing more on 3dD and it being one of the best games of all time (along with the music) it's phenomenal.

text: One of the resident evils was my first Horror themed game. So I guess RE3, REmake, and RE0 are my first ones, since I remember them around the same time, and REmake, specifically the shark part, stands out to me. I watched my brother play, as I was like 7-9, and was too scared to play, and I kinda still am. Not good at RE, cept for 4.
author: dx619hey

text:
Funnily enough, my first horror/action game was also Castlevania IV for the SNES. I must've been around 7, I dont remember exactly. But I still love listening the music from that game to this day, even though my fav of the series is actually SOTN that I first played on the PS1 and now I have it on my 360 :)

I recommend the Dracula battle rock arrange I and II albums for anyone who wants to hear kick-ass heavy metal versions of all these classics!! Those two albums have no equal, IMO.
author: CleverDjembe

text:
Castlevania on the Game Boy was the first 
my favourite castlevania are Dawn of Sorrow for DS 
Harmony of Dissonance for Gba and Simphony of the Night for Ps1
author: LeleSocho

text:
My first horror themed game would probably be Castlevania 2, I missed the first one. Glad I had Nintendo Power for that one. 

My favorite would be Silent Hill 1 or 2. They're not horror "themed" though. They ARE horror. Resident Evil and Castlevania are horror themed because you don't feel horror while you're playing them. Not usually anyway.
author: Namingway

text:
Great job SupraDarky.  Congrats on vid # 600 for this series.  I've never played any of the castlevania games (I really should), but the first "horror themed" game I had to play was probably (if you count it) Doom or Area 51, old shooters for arcades.

If they don't count then it goes to either RE2 or Parasite Eve.

Fave horror game would have to be System Shock 2. The atmosphere was just amazing for the limited tech.

text:
First horror-themed game I EVER EVER played? Resident Evil.

And my favorite game in the Castlevania series would have to be Symphony of the Night, closely followed by Super Castlevania IV. I'm a sucker for non-linear gameplay, exploration, leveling up and collecting things. 

The Castlevania games for Game Boy Advance are also superb, IMO.
